DOC.brief_summary: Investigators interested learn appetite responds certain type starch fiber mixture . In research study , subject ask consume cookie bar contain different type starch fiber mixture , describe feeling hunger , fullness desire eat 3 hour study period . Subjects ask four separate occasion . Following 3 hour study period , deli-style lunch serve . Investigators want see appetite responds four different starch fiber mixture .
DOC.brief_title: Types Resistant Starch Their Effect Appetite
DOC.detailed_description: This study require one initial screen visit ( approximately 1 hour ) four study visit last approximately 4 hour . All visit do 2 month . We look healthy , non-smoking , premenopausal female volunteer older 18 medical history diabetic , heart , lung , kidney , stomach , liver disease . The initial screening visit determine subject eligibility height , weight waist circumference measurement , blood glucose finger prick eating , health mood survey . If willing eligible participate , subject four study visit . All study visit schedule accord individual subject 's menstrual cycle . At visit subject ask eat cookie bar answer question feeling hunger , fullness desire eat . Subject continue answer question feeling hunger , fullness desire eat specific time point 3 hour eat yogurt . After 3 hour lunch meal serve . The lunch meal consist typical deli item , pasta , roll , salad , etc . Subject allow eat much little lunch 'd like .
DOC.criteria: Premenopausal females 18 year age old BMI ( body mass index ) 18.5 24.9 kg/m2 inclusive No clinical evidence cardiovascular , metabolic , respiratory , renal , gastrointestinal hepatic disease unrestrained eater ( score < 10 Three Factor Eating Questionnaire ) Pregnant and/or lactate plan pregnancy Allergies intolerances food consume study Fasting blood glucose > 110 mg/dL . Subjects identify elevated fast blood glucose level advise contact primary care physician appropriate followup care . Taking counter fiber supplement supplement may interfere study procedure endpoint Taking prescription medication may interfere study procedure endpoint ( medication affect appetite ) Subjects unusual dietary habit ( e.g . pica ) Actively lose weight try lose weight ( unstable body weight fluctuation > 5 kg 60 day period ) Excessive exerciser train athlete Addicted drug and/or alcohol Medically document psychiatric neurological disturbance Smoker ( past smoker may allow cessation > 2 year )
